Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Andreas> I'm not sure I understand the cryptopia news correctly. Please correct me if I'm wrong, but does this mean that:
Cryptopia is bankrupt. The "Liquidator" company will sell all crypto that was held on Cryptopia and then it will pay out everyone (in BTC or USD... who knows) after deducting the stolen part, so everyone will get less, even if only the ETH was stolen.
Does this mean that we will see a huge amont of crypto being sold in the market on other exchanges soon? ... I can't believe how they can sell 2-300k HUSH ...the other exchanges doesn't have that volume. It would totally crash the price.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> They had a massive security breach, there were a lot of coins stolen. Iâ€™m not sure what their approach will be.

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <jabe> I assume they have creditors to pay: staff wages, rent, taxes, suppliers.
The liquidators will also need to be paid which is probably the biggest expense.
They will have some assets to sell including some of their own coins.
I'm not sure what value of customers' coins they have but surely they would only need to liquidate a percentage in order to cover all liabilities.

Content: [dscrd-hush] <jabe> @Andreas  and as you say they will be no value in many of the smaller coins so they might just as well give them back

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <alexn> I had more than near 4k-5k hush on cryptopia, so there is a chance for me to get it back?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I actually left 90% of details out of the whitepaper, out of respect for Cryptopia and because we were actively trying to get Hush back on track there. Now that they are giving up, it feels like it's time to open source all of it. Some of the details give us some important numbers, like how much HUSH was on cryptopia at the time of the attack and stuff like that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @alexn best chance for you to get it back is to stay active here, subscribe to Hush on blockfolio + twitter and you will hear about whatever actions you will need to take

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If I said "tell use how much Hush you had on cryptopia or a screenshot", obviously dumb people are going to try to abuse that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So we need to come up with an imperfect-but-better-than-nothing system

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> Be cautious what details you do release. Privacy, confidentiality agreements, legal agreements, blah blah blah, etc...
